2011-2013

Entered Brown Univ. with a Chem Eng focus. Internship + research left me unsatisfied. Craved a field with more creativity, and human consideration. Started dabbling in design courses at Brown & RISD.

2014

Continued engineering coursework, while delving into industrial design courses junior + senior years. Sought out extra-curriculars to combine engineering/design approach to problem-solving, and started neuro-engineering thesis.

2015-2016

Developed (digital) thesis. Fascinated with the idea of creating using pure logic. Graduated with biomed engineering degree, and found job as healthcare data analyst to build creative coding skills. Picked up front-end dev + datavis projects outside of work.
